text: Who has believed our message,
and to whom has the arm of Yahweh been revealed?
For\f + \fr 53:2 \ft Or “And” \f* he went\f + \fr 53:2 \ft Or “grew” \f* up like \add a\add* shoot before him,
and like \add a\add* root from dry ground.
He had no form and no majesty that\f + \fr 53:2 \ft Or “and” \f* we should see him,
and no appearance that\f + \fr 53:2 \ft Or “and” \f* we should take pleasure in him.
\add He was\add* despised and rejected \add by\add* men,
a man of suffering, and acquainted with\f + \fr 53:3 \ft Or “knowledgeable of” \f* sickness,
and like ⸤one from whom others hide their faces⸥,\f + \fr 53:3 \ft Literally “hiding of face from him” \f* \add he was\add* despised,
and we did not hold him in high regard.
However, he was the one who lifted up our sicknesses,
and he carried our pain,
yet\f + \fr 53:4 \ft Or “and” \f* we ourselves assumed him stricken,
struck down \add by\add* God and afflicted.
But\f + \fr 53:5 \ft Or “And” \f* he \add was\add* pierced\f + \fr 53:5 \ft Or “wounded” \f* because of our transgressions,
crushed because of our iniquities;
the chastisement for\f + \fr 53:5 \ft Or “of” \f* our peace\f + \fr 53:5 \ft Or “healing” \f* \add was\add* upon him,
and by his wounds\f + \fr 53:5 \ft Hebrew “wound” \f* ⸤we were healed⸥.\f + \fr 53:5 \ft Literally “it was healed for us” \f*
All of us have wandered about like sheep;
we each have turned to his own way;
and Yahweh let fall on him
the iniquity of us all.
He was oppressed and afflicted,
yet\f + \fr 53:7 \ft Or “and” \f* he did not open his mouth;
he was brought like \add a\add* lamb to \add the\add* slaughter,
and like a sheep is dumb before its shearers,
so\f + \fr 53:7 \ft Or “and” \f* he did not open his mouth.
He was taken by restraint of justice,
and who concerned himself with his generation?
For he was cut off from the land of \add the\add* living;
he \add received a\add* blow because of the transgression of my people.
He made\f + \fr 53:9 \ft Or “gave” \f* his grave with \add the\add* wicked,
and with \add the\add* rich in his death,
although he had done no violence,
and \add there was\add* no deceit in his mouth.
Yet\f + \fr 53:10 \ft Or “And” \f* Yahweh was pleased to crush him;
he ⸤made him sick⸥.\f + \fr 53:10 \ft Literally “he made sick” \f*
If she\f + \fr 53:10 \ft Or “you” \f* places\f + \fr 53:10 \ft Or “makes” \f* his life a guilt offering,\f + \fr 53:10 \ft Or “compensation” \f*
he will see offspring.
He will prolong days,
and the will of Yahweh will succeed in his hand.
From the trouble of his life\f + \fr 53:11 \ft Or “soul” \f* he will see;\f + \fr 53:11 \ft Dead Sea Scrolls add “light” \f*
he will be satisfied.
In his knowledge, \add the\add* righteous \add one\add*, my servant, shall declare many righteous,\f + \fr 53:11 \ft Or “right” \f*
and he is the one who will bear their iniquities.
Therefore, I will divide to him \add a portion\add* among the many,\f + \fr 53:12 \ft Or “great” \f*
and with \add the\add* strong ones he will divide bounty,
⸤because⸥\f + \fr 53:12 \ft Literally “Instead of that” \f* he poured his life out to death
and was counted with \add the\add* transgressors;
and\f + \fr 53:12 \ft Or “yet” \f* he was the one who bore the sin of many
and will intercede for the transgressors.
